meanings.definition: The quality or state of being contemporary.
meanings.sent1: The contemporaneity of their fashion choices made them stand out.
meanings.sent2: The contemporaneity of the two paintings was evident in their similar styles.
meanings.sent3: The party had a theme of contemporaneity, with guests dressing in futuristic outfits.
meanings.sent4: The music festival captured the spirit of contemporaneity, blending old and new sounds.
meanings.sent5: In the art exhibition, the artist showcased the contemporaneity of different art movements.

meanings.definition: The condition of existing or occurring at the same time.
meanings.sent1: The contemporaneity of the two events caused confusion among the attendees.
meanings.sent2: The contemporaneity of the meetings made it challenging for him to attend both.
meanings.sent3: The coincidental contemporaneity of their birthdays led to a joint celebration.
meanings.sent4: The contemporaneity of the thunder and lightning added to the intensity of the storm.
meanings.sent5: The contemporaneity of the traffic lights caused a smooth flow of vehicles.
